How to play: 
Your cups are the 7 facing you and your store is the larger cup on your right. 
At the start of the game, press a cup on your side after the countdown finishes. The first player to distribute their shells gets the first move. 
If the last shell to be distributed lands in your store, you get another move. 
If the last shell to be distributed lands in one of your empty cups, the shells from the opposite cup are moved to your store. 
The game ends when no shells exist in the cups, and the player with the most shells in their store wins. 

Made by Tim Beswick, Oliver Philip Höhn, Max Karasiński, Martin Kubat and Dovydas Rupšys.

First Move: 
The game of Sungka begins in a simultaneous move mode. In this mode both players make their moves at the same time, the player that exhausts his move first will have the first move in the standard game mode. 
Note that choosing your left most cup will grant you an extra move therefore you would have to exhaust that as well to exhaust all of your moves. 
Your cups are at the bottom of the screen, tap on the screen to begin the first move count down.
First Move Tutorial End: \nThis is the end of the tutorial, go back to the main menu by pressing the button in the center of the screen.

Extra Moves: \nThis tutorial will explain the mechanics of extra moves. An extra move in a game of Sungka is gained when the last shell of the move is dropped in the players store. \nTap on your the left most cup, notice that the last shell ends in your store. This means that you will get an extra turn.

Extra Moves: 
The two right most cups on your side of the board would both lead to an extra move however the order of execution matters. 
For the purpose of this tutorial select the second cup from the right, notice that the right most cup will no longer give you an extra move. 
Both of these cups can give you an extra move if executed in the proper order.
Extra Moves: \nFollow the next couple of moves and notice how multiple extra moves can be chained one after another.

Extra Moves: \nFinally you may have noticed that massive pile of shells in one of you cups. Tap on this cup, observe what happens and remember the rule of an extra move, if the last shell lands in your store you will get an extra move and it doesn\'t matter how.

Robbing Mechanic: \nOne of the rules in the game of Sungka allows the player to steal all shells from the opponents cup. The rule says that if the last shell of the move lands in an empty cup of yours, except your store, then the last shell and all shell from the cup on the opposite side of the board are moved to your store. \nTry this out yourself, select the highlighted cup and see what happens.

Robbing Mechanic: \nIt is very easy to notice obvious moves that lead to robbing but you should be careful because it is very easy to focus too much on these moves and in the process miss negative effects of them. \nTry it one more time and notice that the same rule applies even when it goes through your opponents cups as long as it ends in your cup.
Robbing Mechanic: \nWhenever you have 15 shells in one of your cups performing an action on that cup will always result in a steal. Press on your leftmost cup and see what happens.
End of Tutorial: \nYou can continue playing or you can quit by swiping from the right and using the back button. The player with the most amount of shells in the players store wins the game.
